title: Amazing service and care for my son!
body: My son had eye surgery today and I feel that I must write to say what amazing service and care we received!!! We honestly can not fault anything or anyone!! Our nurse, was outstanding and everyone from the doctors to the cleaners were so kind and friendly. We felt well informed and totally relaxed in their care. We couldn’t have asked for more and it was like having private treatment. It makes us even more proud of the wonderful NHS!!! Thank you!!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring Practice
body: I have nothing but praise for the way I have been treated at this Practice. From the charming receptionist to the caring and excellent treatment received from the Physio. I'm  well on the way to recovery thanks to her.

title: Fantastic care and service
body:
Brought my daughter and grand-daughter in after a road traffic collision to get checked. Check in very easy, staff pleasant and efficient. Children's A&E fantastic, especially triage nurse in green room. They were so caring which is obviously why they do the job they do. Could not fault the service. Thank you. 

(Only downside was rude paramedic outside A & E when we asked a simple question as not from the area and first visit to the hospital!)

title: Excellent Hospital
body: Excellent Hospital staff were outstanding best Hospital I’ve ever attended would highly recommend it.

title: Professional and polite
body: I have been with this surgery for just a short time. Since then, they have been great at treating me. During a recent health scare, they had all my tests ordered and treatment as appropriate. Professional and polite Doctors.

author: MPatient
authorRole: a service user
title: Treatment stopped due to funding
body:
After years of suffering with my condition, my specialist at NHS Tayside prescribed a trial of a treatment to see if this would ease my symptoms. The trial started in September 2021 and was a success and the treatment made a big difference to my quality of life and we agreed to continue the treatment.  
Unfortunately, whilst the treatment has been approved for use in Scotland by SIGN, and is used by other health boards in Scotland, I have experienced continuous problems with NHS Tayside in seeking to have the prescription authorised for on-going treatment. Since the original trial, I have had to continually chase NHS Tayside in order to have this treatment continued. I have relied on the efforts of the administration staff within the department who have been able to arrange with the company for me to have temporary extensions to the prescription. I would like to acknowledge and commend their efforts to help me. However, each time there has been a break in the treatment which has caused worsening of my symptoms and my quality of life.  
In January 2022, I was advised that the company providing the treatment device would not extend the prescription further until the necessary funding arrangements were put in place by NHS Tayside. In February, I contacted the relevant Service Manager within NHS Tayside as I had been advised that the final point in the authorisation process for my treatment was this person. Sadly, I never received a response from the Service Manager but, having also copied NHS Tayside’s Patient Feedback Department, was advised that a temporary extension had been agreed to provide NHS Tayside with time to put in place the funding process.  
In April I contacted NHS Tayside to request the renewal of the prescription as the temporary extension was due to end. I was told the treatment couldn’t be extended because the process had not been put in place yet. As I result, my treatment stopped and my condition has deteriorated significantly.  
I am at a loss to understand why I am being denied a treatment that my specialist has prescribed, which is authorised for use in Scotland; has improved my quality of life; and is available in other health boards in Scotland. I feel like this is a post-code lottery and I am being significantly disadvantaged to the detriment of my health and wellbeing. Not only have the breaks in my treatment worsened my condition but the additional pressure and stress of having to constantly chase NHS Tayside for this treatment to continue is also causing an exacerbation of my symptoms.  
This is not person-centred, safe and effective care and due to the failings of NHS Tayside, my health has been harmed. I am being badly let down by NHS Tayside due to failures of administration. The response to date from Tayside has been to open another complaint with a timescale for resolution of 20 working days, albeit the communication I received from NHS Tayside stated that this timescale was unlikely to be met. 20 days has passed and I’ve been told that I might get a response in another 20 working days. All the while I am left suffering and my health deteriorating

readBy.name: NHS Tayside
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
Scottish Government

title: Absolutely great treatment
body: I cannot praise enough the treatment my husband received in the A & E Department at Maidstone Hospital.  He was taken there by wonderful  paramedics, the ambulance arriving very quickly.  As soon as we arrived at A & E we were taken to a small ward, no waiting at all, and from then on he was treated with no delay and was investigated very thoroughly.  Staff were very caring and efficient at every stage of the visit,  which fortunately had a happy outcome.  I know hospitals are under a lot of pressure and at busy times waiting is involved, which is no fault of the staff.  Because hospitals get a lot of criticism, I wanted people to be aware of our very positive experience.  Thank you Maidstone!

title: Best service by HCA
body: My parents were seen in the practice for their review by the Hca Jabada and are new to uk. I must say my parents received a professional , friendly service from her. My parents were extremely happy that they could also communicate with her. She also booked additional appointments for them that were required, and went out of her reach to give the best service. I recommend them to come to see her often. Thank you

title: Fantastic Light Therapy
body: I have been going for light therapy for 4 months. I only agreed to do it. As nothing else worked. Well it has worked my skin has improved and healed. The nurses have been fantastic. If your offered this service take it

title: regarding staff and outside agencies
body: As a ex patient from Cheswold park Hospital i would like to say how grateful i am for the care and support from the RC down to everyone who works thier including  my offending manager who came from south yorkshire police public protection officer everyone of you should be proud of what you all do  i personally thank everyone of you for the support you gave me whilist at Cheswold once again thankyou mark

title: Terrible: to avoid
body: Terrible service. To book an appointment you have to call them and it takes about an hour. The app (Dr iQ) sometimes doesn't work at all. You cannot make regular blood test appointments on the app, even it's a GP prescription.

title: The worst ever
body: The receptionist was really rude, went to change the time of my appointment and during the time when I was telling her my info, she just left the counter straight away and came back with no apology at all. Had to call them again to book another appointment (again don't understand why they cannot just change my appointment when I was there) and the call never went through.

author: casingrt64
authorRole: a service user
title: Unprofessional interaction when attending for cervical screening
body:
One of your staff shamed me for not having children when I attended for cervical screening today. It was highly inappropriate and invasive.  
The line of questioning went as such:  
_Do you have any children?_  
_Do you want any children?_  
_Why don’t you have any children?_  
When I said ‘I don’t want them right now', the response was 'yeah, it's always not right now, not right now with you people isn't it, haha' in a deeply condescending tone.  
Are these the people that should be working in women’s intimate health? The whole thing is unpleasant and exposing enough without having a random stranger questioning my life choices.  
The whole line of questioning left me feeling deeply uncomfortable. It was unprofessional and uncalled for, and made the rest of the appointment feel incredibly unpleasant.  
As a result, I couldn’t help but tense up and bled way more than I ever had during a gynaecological examination or smear test. I left feeling humiliated and embarrassed.  
Please educate your staff on appropriate ways of talking to patients without letting personal opinions influence their work.

readBy.name: Spring Hill Practice
City & Hackney GP Confederation
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Great practice
body: Hi got high blood pressure have been seeing nurse she was very caring and helpful as are the doctors and staff

author: bellajake91
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: My baby’s referral goes missing after waiting 6 months
body:
I’m sad to tell my story . It is a sad time that is filled with anxiety, worry , sadness and pain. Seeing my 1 year old baby not getting the support from the specialists that she needs is soul destroying .  
It breaks me seeing her suffer and the system is failing her of no fault of her own .  
It started in December 2021 when my daughter was 13 months old and first went onto cows milk. She immediately showed signs of intolerance. She would have explosive diarrhoea within 2 hours of consuming it and a large painful allergy rash appeared .  
After taking my Health Visitors (HV) advice and still no improvement A doctor referred us to the dietician in January 2022. I was told there would be a long wait due to Covid but they didn’t know how long.  
This wait time came with worry and anxiety. I didn’t know what was best to do with my daughters health. During this time my daughters symptoms worsened and we’ve never had any specialists help .  
After 6 months of waiting and me regularly been told to just continue waiting. I was eventually told my daughters referral was never received. I was told it had gone missing. My HV discovered the referral was missing after directly contacting the dietician department .  
The dietician has advised we are referred to paediatrics and I’m absolutely devastated to have been told it’s going to be a 41 week wait.  
We’ve already waited over 6 /7months and now we are now told to wait an additional 10.5 months .  
My daughter has had a wheeze that started around the time of weaning her. Her breathing issues have needed hospitalisation, her wheeze comes randomly and strongly we know this can be triggered by an allergy but she has never been able to get tested, we don’t know what is causing it .  
She has red bumpy allergy rashes that appear on her face which come and go. Her nappies are so messy we can’t start potty training so this is now delaying her development. Her tummy bloats daily after food, it’s painful for her .  
We need to get my daughter prioritised. She needs an allergy test to find out if its triggering my daughters breathing issues. We need her bowels to be functioning normally so it doesn’t delay her development skills with potty training .  
Experiencing all this as a first time mum has affected my trust in the system. It’s affected my mental and physical health. Seeing my helpless daughter being failed by the system by no fault of her own is not acceptable.  
I want to know how this will be prevented in the future? What support with be given to parents?

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
NHS Grampian
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Scottish Recovery Network

author: Dee D
authorRole: the patient
title: Being under this service is unsafe
body:
I have been under this so called service for a good few years now. I had been involved with a couple of Community Psychiatric Nurse's (CPNs) over this time of whom left. I recently was allocated a support worker after being offered one for the last 5 years without success. They were unfortunately non constructive with either advice or support. My mental well being was in meltdown for many weeks and they said I was fine. I was far from fine.  
I was left during the week with the police at my door as I had got to stage of suicide. I made a call to this team and told a pending doctor appointment is in the pipeline, then 2 days later told I am discharged.  
Being under this service is unsafe as in my experience they turn a blind eye to how a patient is. As I have experienced and other patients, if someone calls this team they are asked what they should do as if they don`t know what to do. Really makes a patient feel safe.

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cant access website for repeat prescription
body: Got to a stage where last week near impossible to do an e consult even trying before 10am in morning and now trying to order repeat prescription online cant get onto the website as they have taken down i the evening.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Bradford

title: incompetence beyond belief!
body:
“Your call is important to us please stay on the line… you are number 46 in the queue”

 “ Sorry all appointments for today are now taken please call again tomorrow !”

Emails only get the response “Hello, sorry you will need to contact surgery and speak to GP regarding this.”

Complete incompetence beyond belief!

title: IBD nurse helpline service- No help!
body:
Extremely difficult to contact anyone for advice/support 
No one ever answers the  phone and despite the answer phone message promising a call back within 72hrs still waiting for a call back a week later, despite 
calling requesting a call back on a daily basis
Similar experience several months ago
What is the point of having a helpline service if nurses do not respond to requests for help & advice?
When GP contacted advised to contact IBD nurses !

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Shocking
body:
Suspected heart attack, 2 heart conditions, diabetic, dumped in a corridor on a wheelchair, after morphine in ambulance. Waited 4 hours to see a doc, had to ask for food as sugars dropped too low twice. Nurse from another department offered me a trolly too lie on, so grateful to her.
Complained about chest pains again and was blanked. 
No observations taken, not spoken too but a patient who kept shouting got lots of attention, sure suspected heart attack is more important than a sore ankle? He was in after me and seen and discharged before I saw a doctor.
Never felt so neglected as I did

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Very friendly and very professional
body: Absolutely fantastic service ... Great reception staff and great Consultant Cardiologist!!  Very courteous and extremely professional.  I felt very at ease from the moment I saw the reception staff and the Dr was extremely articulate and explained everything incredibly well.

title: Very positive experience
body: Every time I visit (frequently in recent weeks) I find every staff member helpful and willing to discuss treatments in a friendly and positive manner.

title: Amazing service
body: Given how much pressure gp surgeries are under I’ve been so impressed at how efficient and quick the doctors have been in helping with multiple problems recently. Even when I’ve rang late in the day with urgent issues I’ve still had a call back . I’ve spoken to all the partners and they’ve all been very knowledgeable, understanding and efficient. Thankyou so much.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Excellent service
body:
I found the dr listened well, put me at ease, was understanding, knowledgeable & explained my condition well. 
He was running late but I was made aware of this when I arrived for my appointment, he apologised for the delay & I wasn’t made to feel rushed.

title: Horrible service, inhuman service.
body:
I’ve visit my GP for an emergency check out on my tonsils and ears, after been prescribed antibiotics for over a week, when I’ve got to the GP the doctor told me that I had “quinsy” and should rush to the hospital as it was life threatening.
She then contacted the Barnet hospital( not my choice) which told me to go and spend the night there, they told me to bring clothes and anything else I might need for been admitted for a procedure on my tonsils and that I didn’t need to wait as the doctor was waiting for me.

Getting to the hospital, it was packed, the receptionist completely ignored the emergency that I was in, and told me to wait…
Anyway long short version, I wasn’t offered a bed to sleep, I’ve stay in a very uncomfortable chair, with a high temperature, logs of pain and a bag that I didn’t need. 

I’m so disappointed so disheartened I don’t have words to describe how awful it was this experience.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant receptionist
body:
Due a medication review. Tried to call but long wait so decided to email as it wasn't urgent. However I received an email back within 4 hours stating that I should be able to collect my prescription from the pharmacist. The next day the receptionist called and booked in review and advised that blood test form to be collected from them. Collected the form and spoke with the receptionist on duty regarding another matter and she was extremely pleasant, helpful and everything you could want from a doctors receptionist so thank you.
We are all quick to take the time to complain but not so quick to write when we have a positive experience.

title: Great hospital
body: Dealt with on time and very caring consultant . Everything was explained clearly and patiently making me feel confident to go forward for an operation

title: Always a good experience
body:
My first experience with Cardiology started ten years ago but I have to say the services here just keep getting better and better.
I have never had any reason to complain about this department as they are first class on everything they do

title: excellent service
body: The practice is very quick and efficient in dealing with queries and appointments are seen on time. Very nice and friendly staff

title: Lack of information
body: Difficult to get appointments on the phone and face to face. No follow up on notes, I had to ring the surgery to chase up referrals which hadn't been made. When I rang to speak to a doctor to understand more about the diagnosis I found her unhelpful and felt like I was wasting her time.

title: Very professional
body: I was seen on time and my appointment with the nurse was professionally dealt with in a friendly manner.

title: Efficient
body:
GP was very helpful, efficient. 
Practice is very clean. 
The reception works fine. 
Booking time was reasonable.

title: Bent over backwards to help
body: I came for an appointment with my daughter in wheelchair, accessible! She got her appointment mixed up with physio but they still fitted her in as an emergency.. The receptionist was amazing and helped with booking a few different future appointments needed, the doctor also went above and beyond!! This is my daughters doctors and I'm envious! Mine which is in different town which is amazing but if I could change and come here I would do it in a heart beat 💓 the receptionist needs recognising for what she did for my daughter. Just need to email prescription staff to put her meds on one script now. Never had nhs service like this! 👍 ❣️

title: very helpful team
body: thank you for helping with supporting letter and advice , always going the extra mile , i love this surgery the team are good and building is very nice always helping community

title: Excellent care
body:
I just wanted to write and express my thanks and appreciation to all the staff at Eastbourne Hospital.
I was recently admitted to Litlington Ward. All the staff were so very kind and patient and made my stay as comfortable as possible. 
I also wanted to thank your comms team, or whoever is responsible for your web-site, as the online Urology patient information leaflets were really useful and helped me prepare for the whole process.

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Always helpful
body: This practice is always helpful even whilst under pressure the receptionists remain patient and empathetic

title: Fantastic practice
body: I have not been at the practice but I have to say what a fantastic experience I've had so far. My little boy has had his immunisations here and the staff were so kind and patient with us both. I didn't feel rushed, I was listened to and treated with kindness and understanding. I have had a smear today and was slightly dreading it (they have been very uncomfortable in the past). This time I barely felt it! The nurse was friendly and put me at ease and was so efficient and gentle I had to check she had actually done it! Very impressed and very grateful.

title: excellent
body: attended for my 12 weekly prostap 3 injection. seen quickly as usual. nurses very professional. felt very comfortable.

title: Great service
body:
I called on a very busy Thursday morning, the receptionist was apologetic & polite when I eventually got through. 
She listened to my problem about pain in my knee & decided that an appointment with the physio would be more effective & quicker for me than me seeing a GP much later in the day and then likely getting referred to the physio anyway.  The appointment led to pain relief,  leg brace & exercises for a bit further down the line plus a follow up appointment this week 
I just wanted to message as I’m sure you get lots of complaints but although fortunately I don’t need your services often when I do the reception staff are very good, sympathetic, have an awareness of what might work best and do what they can to ensure it’s the most effective resolution. 
Well done to your staff!

title: A very supportive team
body: Obviously we only contact a medical centre when we have a problem, so to feel that I am being listened to, that someone is doing their best to understand and help is very reassuring. This has been my experience every time, whatever my reason for contacting Westcourt, and I would like to express my gratitude.

title: Lovely practice
body:
I recently moved to St David's from another GP as they were extremely unhelpful.
I called St David's to arrange appointments for myself and my baby and each time I called, I was always caller number 1 and my call was answered quickly. The ladies at the reception are very helpful and knowledgeable. I had no issues with arranging my appointments at the time that suits me which was a big issue with the previous GP. 
I was anxious to change my GP after 6 years but it was definitely a good decision.
Highly recommended.

title: Excellent Pre-Assessment Team - St Marks Hospital
body: Prior to surgery and admittance to Gladstone 2 ward, i was emailed by pre-assesment clinic team who were extremely helpful and efficient in ensuring all the correct documentation was received and returned prior to surgery. Thanks to all staff who replied swiftly to my emailed queries. Very efficient and effective team. Coming to Central Middlesex hospital as part of St Marks has been a blessing, where efficient, professional staff work hard for their patients. A credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: phasefp99
authorRole: the patient
title: The 2 most loveliest nurses I have ever met
body:
I was admitted to Fredrick Salmon South at the beginning of June for 4 weeks to have Total Parental Nutrition (TPN) as I was very underweight and needed an operation.  
As soon as I was settled into my bed I was greeted by 2 nurses Kirsty and Elaine. I have never felt so comfortable and welcome. They were the 2 most loveliest nurses I have ever met. In the end we became very good friends and I would like to thank them both from bottom of my heart. They do an amazing job.  
So please pass this message onto them and if they can call me I would be grateful .

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Incredible levels of care
body:
My care has been incredible so far and there can be no questions about it. The care I am receiving has been top class and I feel like it will continue to be this good thanks to the staff.  
The nurses are all very hard working and are never really off their feet. They also do a truly spectacular job for their whole shift something that is so incredible and has allowed me to gain a new respect for them.  
The doctors are always fantastic and cannot fault a single one of the ones that I have seen.  
The food is fine and I cannot complain about the portions that I receive as they are always very filling.  
I have had no issues or problems with my care which has made my stay in hospital a lot easier and I feel has benefited my treatment.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Truly exceptional care
body:
My care in the hospital has been truly exceptional in the hospital and I feel privileged in having received such a high level of care. My care has been so good thanks to the staff I have come into contact with they are all incredibly exceptional.  
The nurses have been so kind and do a great job in checking up on us and making sure we are all okay and have no concerns.  
The doctors do a fantastic job with their explanations and ensuring I understand my care.  
The food is okay at times it can be a little bland but I cannot really expect too much.  
The cleaning they do a very good job with very thorough and cause no issues. I have had no issues and am grateful for my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care in the hospital has been absolutely great
body:
My care in the hospital has been absolutely great and I am so happy with the care that I have been receiving.  
The nurses have all been very friendly towards me and have been so kind in ensuring that I get the best passive care that they can give me.  
The doctors are always dead on towards me being kind and taking time when I don’t understand to explain anything and make my treatment plan clear.  
The food I am not a big fan of as it is resistive and rarely changes which after a few days gets very boring and really repetitive.  
My care has been good with the cleaning very impressive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a service user
title: My care in the ward has been truly great so far
body:
My care in the ward has been truly great so far and I can truly say that I have had absolutely no issues so far.  
It has been very impressive in how good the nurses are. They literally could not do a better job as they are so good at what they do and have been so kind to me and my fellow patients being so good at what they do.  
The doctors I haven’t really seen much of or spoke to ever since I arrived onto the ward from the ED.  
The food is okay however I haven’t had the chance to get a menu yet.  
The cleaning is excellent with the cleaners doing a terrific job and can be very happy with their efforts.  
The hospital has been a fantastic place to recover with no issues I am more than happy

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been excellent
body:
My care in the hospital has been excellent and I honestly do not think that I could better care anywhere in the hospital as it has been so impressive so far.  
The nurses are all very good and there isn’t a bad one amongst them they are all so kind with a consistent high level of care. They have all been very helpful and have been great in getting me things such as a cup of tea efficiently.  
The doctors I haven’t seen much however when they do come round they are very good at what they do however I do struggle to understand them...  
The food is very good and I always get enough to eat something that makes being in hospital a lot easier. Everything is great in the hospital and I have had no issues so far

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Cannot complain about my care
body:
My care in the hospital has been going very well so far and I have been very impressed with the care that I have been receiving.  
The nurses are very good and have been very kind to me ever since my admission.  
The doctors that I have seen are quite nice however I do see a lot of different ones which can often be confusing in knowing who is for what purpose.  
The food I don’t enjoy as I am missing some of the food that I would commonly have when at home however his obviously isn’t the hospitals fault.  
I have had no issues with anything in the hospital and cannot complain about my experience

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Always happy with the food
body:
My care has been very good in the hospital with the cause of this excellent care being the staff that I have been treated and looked after by.  
The nurses have been so kind to me always taking time to make sure I am okay and have a nice conversation which makes me feel a lot more at ease about the whole hospital experience.  
The doctors are very good and you can tell that they enjoy their job which makes their care feel a lot better as they don’t see it as chore.  
The food I really enjoy and I am always more than happy with the portions that I get. I have had no issues and hope for a speedy discharge.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has really not been an enjoyable experience
body:
My care has really not been an enjoyable experience and I long for it to get better. I am currently in a side room at the very end of the ward which means I rarely see people.  
I might be lucky if I see a nurse an hour which at times has been so lonely and really gets me down. I have no one to talk to and no company which has got to be very boring over the past few days.  
The nurses are good and do a wonderful job in looking after me. The doctors I don’t see enough to give an accurate comment on so can’t really judge them.  
Most of the food that I get is good however it has been very repetitive I have found.  
The cleaning is the only thing that I can say is a ten out of ten.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cruxwp84
authorRole: the patient
title: We will never forget the care
body:
My husband and I would like to thank the Maple Team at Stirling Community Hospital and Lucia and Louisa at Forth Valley Royal for their care and expertise throughout our pregnancy and birth.  
I looked forward to each appointment throughout pregnancy with the Maple Team (special thanks to Abi) and felt listened to and looked after at every visit.  
The day I went into labour I called triage at Forth Valley Royal twice before making the journey to hospital and both midwives I spoke to were helpful and reassuring. I was assigned a birth suite with pool which was my preference and was under the care of Lucia and a student midwife Louisa throughout my labour.  
We simply can't praise the girls highly enough for how calm, professional and caring they were. They really made me feel safe and my husband appreciated how involved they allowed him to be, working around him and never asking him to leave my side.  
Birth is an overwhelming and incredible experience and we'll never forget the care we received bringing our beautiful son into the world. Thank you all.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have not enjoyed the experience
body:
My care in the hospital has been bad so far and I have not enjoyed the experience that I have had in the hospital.  
They are constantly drawing blood out of me with my arms being black and blue bruised with the amount of blood thy have taken for various tests.  
The nurses are nice enough and do their best but the constant tests do get on my nerves. I have seen so many different doctors so I cannot even pass judgement on any of them due to the limited interactions.  
The food I also do not enjoy as I feel choices are limited and taste is poor. I really hope that my care improves

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a service user
title: Treated very well
body:
I feel like I have been treated very well in the hospital and have been very impressed with the care that I am receiving.  
The nurses are young however despite their youth they still do a very impressive job and have been so kind to me ever since I arrived.  
The doctors are very good and have been great with their explanations of everything which has helped me out a lot since my arrival. I don’t understand them at times however this is due to me being very hard of hearing.  
The food I have really enjoyed and always get enough to eat.  
The cleaning is done very well always very thorough. I have had no issues since arriving and want to thank the staff for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: scoreboardyn84
authorRole: a service user
title: No access to crisis team when needed them
body:
To get an assessment with the crisis team so you can stay at home and not be admitted ( which in my case is always on a section) you have to ring the awful crisis line. Awful because no compassion at all in my experience and seemed to be staffed by such angry people. Which is last thing needed when suicidal and have made plans to end life which I had done.  
Rang them 3 times and swear will never do again as made me worse. was told couldn't be assessed as that wasn't the process or policy yet they offered no support at all. Really bad experience when suicidal and took so much out of me to call them, I don't know what to do and I am not going to go to a A&E because that is so traumatic when have a mental health crisis and the hub at St Pancras hospital turns you away if don't have an appointment. I needed to be safe in my own home which I cant go back to now as I live on my own and I am unsafe on my own.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent experience
body: I had to attend the accident and emergency department after a fall on Saturday 2nd July. I was attended to and discharged well within 3 hours. All the staff were lovely, polite, caring and attentive. I have also attended other outpatient departments over many years, and been an inpatient on a couple of occasions and always had excellent care. I would highly recommend this hospital.

readBy.name: Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Awaiting a package of care at home to facilitate discharge
body:
My care in the hospital gas been absolutely fine so far however I am wanting to get home but am currently awaiting a package of care at home in order to facilitate a discharge.  
The nurses are absolutely great and I can honestly say that I can have no complaints about the care that I am currently receiving as it is more than impressive.  
The food is absolutely excellent and I have enjoyed every meal that I have received so far.  
All the staff are brilliant at their job and have made everything so easy to understand and the only difficulties I encounter are with accents.  
My care has been excellent as the attention I am getting is incredible and it has helped me feel so much better recently.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent professional staff
body: I underwent anaesthetic treatment prior to surgery last week (Thursday), met the anaesthetist who was extremely thorough in explaining the procedure and then listened to my concerns about opioids without judgement. Explained the importance of being calm and settled before being sent to sleep and together agreed a plan for this and ongoing pain relief after. Met a second anaesthetist who used his good sense of humour to good effect to keep things calm and light and with a gentle stroking of my forehead went out like a light, very relaxed. Everything possible was done to put me at ease. Excellent professionals involved, a credit to the NHS.  Now home recuperating, till the next operation.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent
body: I've been at the practise for 6 years and the service has always been excellent. The online requests forms are great. All the staff are friendly and happy to help. Couldn't recommend enough.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Excellent Stoma Team
body: Last week I underwent surgery for a stoma bag to be fitted, life changing surgery. However fear was reduced enormously by the highly efficient, professional and caring stoma nurses I came into contact with both prior to and after the surgery. A video consultation with 'A' who explained everything thoroughly beforehand and the types of bags you could have, the support available and then answered with great patience my numerous questions that put me thoroughly at ease, to meeting other nurses on the ward 'S and 'R' who sited the positioning accurately and 'R' who had the task after surgery to teach me about changing my bag, helped dispel the squeamishness I initially felt and made no fuss but calmy explained the best way to manage things I a dignified way. Taking all my fears away. This enabled me to leave hospital sooner as I felt fully able to manage my stoma myself at home. A follow up call on my return home to ensure I had everything I needed was appreciated and ongoing transfer to my local hospital was being dealt with swiftly and efficiently. At all times this  team have been wonderful in ensuring what could have been a challenging time has been properly managed and given me the crucial support I needed to move forward in my health care. They are a credit to the NHS!!! Thank you.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Relaxed atmosphere
body:
I underwent a cataract procedure and I was extremely satisfied with the surgeon and team.
Also I felt I was in good care with all the hospital staff both clinical and admin.
It was a lovely quiet and relaxing area.
Well done guys.

readBy.name: Circle

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am very impressed with the care I have been receiving
body:
My care in the hospital has been very good and I am very impressed with the care I have been receiving.  
The nurses have been so nice to me and are always doing their best to try and give me the best possible care.  
They are at times quite difficult to understand however thus is due to a lot of different accents which at times can be very difficult. They are all very good at what they do.  
The doctors I don’t see much however when I do he is very polite and kind to me.  
The food is very good and I enjoy the portions that I receive. I have had no issues since my arrival and am grateful for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A great practice
body: We have been patients for a number of years and have always appreciated the great service.  We rang the surgery last week as my husband was quite unwell with shortness of breath. Within an hour a GP telephone us back and sent us a link to do a video call which worked perfectly.  He attended the next day for blood tests and an ECG.  We are just awaiting the results but very much appreciate such prompt attention.  I noticed there are several negative comments about contacting the surgery but we have never had a problem.  Thank you to all the staff.

title: Wonderful Service
body:
Only yesterday I had a cataract removed from my left eye at the Nottingham Branch of CHEC and already my sight has stabilised and I am enjoying much improved vision.
From my initial contact with CHEC to the prompt carrying out of the procedure, everything has run like clockwork thanks mainly to their wonderful staff and their excellent people skills.

title: Absolutely superb
body:
My wife took ill quite quickly and I was in a blind panic. Phoned and a higher grade nurse (not allowed to leave her name, but she will know who she is) phoned back pretty much straight away. My stress and worry levels were through the roof, but the nurse remained completely calm and instructed me what to do. We went straight to the hospital for an x Ray and blood test, they were ready for us when we got there. Turns out my wife has pneumonia which is very dangerous.
I would like to thank this wonderful nurse, because without her prompt actions both dealing with my wife and my stress, who knows what may have happened. Thank you.

title: Professional and very kind team
body: All the orthopaedic team and staff on Littlington ward were fantastic, all went smoothly and kindly. Special thanks to anaesthesiology who found a way to do a GA without leaving me feeling sick, which was my previous experience - very very impressed and grateful

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptional staff
body:
There have been absolutely no issues with my care as it has been absolutely brilliant which is something that I am more than happy with which has impressed me a lot.  
I have no problems at all since my arrival thanks to the incredible staff that have done so well to look after me.  
The nurses that are the main part of my care are all very good and have worked so hard to make me feel comfortable.  
The food is great and I really enjoy it with the portions being very large.  
I have been able to recover very well in the ward thanks to the exceptional staff that have worked very hard in order to facilitate the best possible care for me which I thank them all for as they have been incredible

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good customer care and very helpful
body: ABU really help me and I would  like to say big thanks to him he is very helpful and understand patient situation well done keep it up

title: Excellent
body: Since moving here in april, the practice has helped with transfer to Burton hospital, emergency repeat prescription. Friendly and attentive staff. Cannot thank them enough

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care on the ward
body:
My care on the ward is very good and I have been thoroughly impressed with the care that I have been receiving as it has been truly exceptional and something that I have been more than impressed with it.  
The nurses have been incredibly kind and have taken so much time and effort in order to take good care of me.  
The food has been very nice and I am more than happy with what I get. The care that I have received is so good and I thank them for that.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Awesome Experience
body: I was really nervous about my procedure of removing the coil, but the staff and esp the nurse made it all so comfortable for me.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I will miss having my meals handed to me!
body: I came to lurgan last week, but my stay will be a short one as I will be heading home this week or next, fingers crossed. My stay so far has been really good, I honestly couldn’t complain about one thing. Everyone is so nice and friendly and it really makes the time in here a lot easier. I was always chatting away to the nurses and they are always all ears. They are very caring. The food has been very nice, I will definitely miss getting my breakfast lunch and dinner being handed to me! The cleanliness is perfect, I honesty haven’t seen a floor shine as much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Always spick and span
body: I came to lurgan hospital after I had a bad fall, so I am now just receiving physio and taking some time to rest, I hope I am not here for too long. The staff are all really lovely, I couldn’t say a bad word about any of them, and they are always really helpful and can’t do enough for you. The cleaners do a great job keeping the ward spick and span, definitely no worries about the cleanliness as it is superb. I wouldn’t make any changes at all to my stay I am quite content and lurgan is a very lovely and peaceful hospital. The staff definitely are always giving you their full attention.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good nurses & my room is clean
body: I came over to lurgan 2 nights ago, I was brought over by ambulance which took maybe about 2 hours. The nurses are all really good, I am definitely in great hands. The food is okay, I am not the biggest fan, and I suppose it’s just basic hospital food. My room is kept very clean at all times, cleanliness is great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lepuskk54
authorRole: the patient
title: I recently went for a MRI scan & didn't know what to expect
body:
I recently went for a MRI scan & really didn't know what to expect. The nurse was friendly but I wasn't offered any earphones to listen to music or an eyemask ( I didn't know you could have these things). I went in & had a panic attack, it was a horrible experience, the nurse got me out & told me to go back to the Dr's which I did. I was prescribed medication for my next visit to help feel more relaxed.  
The 2nd time I went couldn't have been more different , because of how nervous I was the nurse took me to a bigger scanner.I was offered music & an eyemask & what a difference it made I felt relaxed throughout.  
The nursing staff were absolutely fantastic & really helped me through it, I definitely wouldn't worry if I had to have an MRI in the future so thankyou so much for all your kindness .

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Lovely Nurse
body:
I have just had a great appointment with a lovely Nurse this morning .
She showed empathy and understood my anxiety .
I was never rushed .
I will request her again .

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Enjoyable stay
body:
I arrived in lurgan from Craigavon area hospital a few days ago through the ED, the ambulance brought me over just after dinner I think I arrived in lurgan about 6.30 or so, just in time for some supper! The food is very nice in lurgan, there are a few things I am not fond on like the soup as such, but the other meals are quite nice and I have found myself trying foods that I would never usually go for like chicken curry, I usually just stick to potatoes.  
The staff are all so nice and very friendly characters, you can always have a good wee chat with them as they are very down to earth and friendly. I used to be a nurse myself and I can see that everyone works so hard and they are all doing an amazing job. The cleanliness is very good, the ward is very well looked after. I have had a few physio sessions which I really enjoy to get up and moving, even if it is just a walk up and down the ward it’s always good to have a wee nosy about, as I feel very lazy just siting about all day. I can keep myself content most of the time as I usually do a few word searches or I have my own iPad which I can go on although I have to get someone to help me with as I’m not very good with the high tech stuff!😂

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Caring for Dad
body:
Dear Sangita, Rose and all of you lovely people who looked after my Dad  
Dad passed away in April. No more suffering. You all made Dad's last weeks of his life more bearable and comfortable for him.

readBy.name: St Lukes Hospice (Harrow & Brent)

title: Great advice and understanding
body:
I was struggling with low energy, headaches, tiredness and was recommended to go back to therapy by my GP. I had gone through the experience before a year ago, and thought my tiredness was unrelated to depression/anxiety.

However, the therapist was very understanding of my situation and we worked together to fight the tiredness. The first week or two I didn't notice getting any better, but there was always actionable things to do after the sessions, lots of resources and I never left feeling like I didn't know what to do next.

The best part was the advice and little tidbits of information - about how emotions are an evolutionary advantage and not something to be discarded, about changing up the scheduling technique each week to see what sticks.

At one point we had a 2 week break. I found the 2 week break better than the 1 week breaks - I really had time to put the techniques into practice and come up with other questions. I'd recommend giving people the option to have 2 weeks in between sessions.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

author: augustyd34
authorRole: the patient
title: Treatment for a fall and head injury
body:
I had a bad fall at The House of Bruar Blair Atholl  
After receiving first aid I went to The Pitlochry Community Hospital  
I was seen and treated within 10 minutes of arrival.  
I'm extremely grateful to the Nurse, Mary, who treated me, put me at ease and provided information for follow-up care.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside
Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Made to feel welcome
body:
Made to feel very welcome. Staff helped us to move Mum's bed so she could be involved in conversations. Thanks for the tea!  
Thank you for everything.

readBy.name: St Lukes Hospice (Harrow & Brent)

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Wound care and so grateful to staff
body:
To Maria and Claire  
Both of your nurses are very professional in dressing my face. I have not seen anything like it. Thanks for your dedication to my face.Thank you very very much. I don't think I could have recovered in the way I have.

readBy.name: St Lukes Hospice (Harrow & Brent)

title: Respectful care
body: I was listened to regarding my problem, from my first appointment preop till my last appointment post op. I was treated holistically by all staff. I was put at ease on arrival by all staff & throughout my stay including night staff. I felt all my needs were adhered to.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Thanks for supporting her final journey
body:
To all the staff at St Luke's Hospice  
A big thank you from the bottom of our heart for taking care of our Mum/ Sister in her final journey. Your love, kindness and warmth given to her is greatly appreciated.  
May god bless you all abundantly.

readBy.name: St Lukes Hospice (Harrow & Brent)

author: South Eastern HSC Trust
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good assessment
body: My experience in the Downe Hospital Rapid Assessment Centre was excellent, very clean and comfortable environment, the nurses were all very pleasant, polite and really put me at ease. The doctors did a really good assessment. It was a really positive experience and it is a fabulous service.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: South Eastern HSC Trust
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great team work
body: All staff on the ward - nurses, porters and carers extremely pleasant and helpful. They all do an amazing job under difficult circumstances. Staff were all very kind and showed great compassion to all patients around me. Great team work!!!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: South Eastern HSC Trust
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Second to none
body: My experience as an inpatient was second to none. I arrived one evening in severe pain. The staff were friendly, diligent and highly professional throughout. It was a good experience at a time when I needed it. I was amazed to see everyone working as a team: the girls on admin, the cleaners, nurse, students and assistants, everyone knew their jobs and carried it out to the best of their ability. It was a wonderful experience but I'm sure everyone will understand if I don't come back in a hurry! Many thanks.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Felt right at home
body: I arrived here with my son at 7am this morning following a referral to the ward from our GP. Once we arrived we were brought into this room and made comfortable by the staff. The staff so far have been excellent and have helped us feel right at home. We had one visit from a doctor who just give me a small debrief. We have been offered tea and other snacks but haven’t had any meals. We are comfortable here and the facilities look great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: great practice
body: On joining the surgery a couple of weeks ago I found the staff very welcoming .The lady on reception was very pleasant and talked me through the process on registration.The nurses were also very pleasant when seen for a health check and vaccination.When entering the surgery there seems a welcoming atmosphere and staff go out of their way to assist the patients.Well done for having a well run surgery

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are brilliant but food not so much
body: Me and my son arrived here on Friday afternoon via a GP referral. Once we arrived we were brought into a room and seen to by a doctor. The staff are brilliant, they are very helpful and professional. I am getting good updates too and am hopeful we will be discharged soon. The food is not great, I find myself not eating any of it sometimes and the variety is the same every day. We are very comfortable here and the facilities are excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Waited 3 hours to seen paediatrician
body: I arrived here yesterday with my daughter via the emergency department. We waited for around 3 hours before being seen to by a paediatrician. Once we arrived we got put into a room. The staff are brilliant, they are very helpful and gentle with my daughter. I am getting good updates too. The food is very nice and my daughter seems to enjoy it. We are comfortable here and the facilities are first class.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: eaterer56
authorRole: a service user
title: Safe & Secure
body: When I came to Bassetlaw Hospice I thought I would not go home again. After 16 days I am on my way home thanks to the care and dedication of all the staff. They make you feel wonderful, safe and secure Thank you

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: matarwg47
authorRole: a service user
title: That is why I recovered so quickly
body: The members of the team who came to see me, was very friendly, kind, understanding and very supportive. They had that special calming effect, which made me bale to open up and talk about my problems. I think that is why I recovered so quickly. I cannot thank them all so much. The members were so very good at listening to me. and with their support, they advised me how to do the right way to tackle my problem. I could not think of anyway that the team can improve, they all so helpful. Because they gave me the chance to speak out and to help myself also sort problems out. Not one of the team ever looked down at me and this made me like I was someone and I was important I felt they had been friend for years. Please keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: LisaB22
authorRole: a service user
title: I feel so much more equipped to deal with my day to day life
body:
I received CBT for PTSD after being diagnosed early last year and completing a PTSD workshop. I was helped to work through not only the traumas themselves but also the beliefs and symptoms that I was left with in a much more healthy and productive way.  
The support that I received from my therapist was essential for my recovery and, now that it is over, I feel so much more equipped to deal with my day to day life and finally feel that I have moved on from what happened.

readBy.name: Bromley Healthcare
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great practice
body: Friendly staff, very welcoming they gave me a full checkup and done my blood tests too they will contact me for results.

title: Super Service
body: Everyone very kind, friendly and supportive. Made to feel at ease. Very comfortable environment. Everything was well explained.

title: No care at all
body: Only chance of an appointment is queuing at 8am Mon to Fri,now even that you get told no appointments,never online available. Suffer with recurring condition,known to gp,need antibiotics prescribing,sent walk in, they were baffled an contacted gp ,were told tell him queue up in morning!!!no patient care, all in family who are patients, are totally sick of trying to get any care off this surgery

title: top service
body: Contacted last week concerning my annual review and bloods and an appointment was made for the following Monday at 13.10  when I arrrived  at 1300 the receptionist greeted me with a smile after she completed the telephone call she was  occupied with ,she very quickly ascertained who I was and what I had called for and kindly asked me to take a seat. I was called to my appointment at 1307and treated by a very professional practice nurse who treated me with repect and kindness, she took my bloods and I absolutely did not feel the needle at all, she completed all the necessary tasks and with a smile said thank you. I can only say well done for excellence in this instance.

title: Ok
body: Some staff members were really nice. Some you could tell were really stressed. The a&e waiting area was a mess, and that isn’t the job of the nurses to clean it up. Sorry but they aren’t paid enough, they are stretched it isn’t fair on them. Also why on earth isn’t there any facilities for the staff to get drinks/coffees food at night? Costa closes at 8pm but the hospital is open 24/7? Waiting times are literally over 8 hours! We were there for around this time period and we didn’t see a single cleaner. I’m sorry but the news are saying that covid rates are increasing, so why isn’t there any cleaners? Why are people literally sat on top of one another? The health secretary actually needs to pay a visit to the hospitals, especially a&e! And make changes accordingly! Also BRI get some cleaners for the nights, the nurses shouldn’t be having to mop up blood all whilst seeing to patients!!! Maybe also think about the layout of the waiting are. So much money has been spent on extending the hospital making the main entrance look ‘nicer’ you seem to have forgotten the rest of the hospital and the staff too.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Bradford
Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Online access
body: What’s the point in having access to the online services when there are no appointments available? Call at 7am and told there are no appointments, it’s all over social media to use online services yet no appointments - shocking service
